topic.title: How to Impose a Table-like Index Layout

body.p: In case you need to place on the same line the index labels and links but with some extra alignment constraints, you can use inline blocks to give the index a table-like appearance:

We need to place on the same line the elements having the class:
index/formatted-value This is the text of the index term.
index/refid This element contains a list of links.

We use a fixed width for the formatted value and the links container, almost half of the available width. To achieve the index hierarchical layout, we will set progressive padding to the formatted value text.
